intro: Suregada zanzibariensis, commonly known as Zanzibar spurge, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of East Africa, particularly Zanzibar. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a waxy texture, while the flowers are small and clustered in complex structures called cyathia. It thrives in sandy or limestone soils and is often found in coastal dunes and dry woodlands.
